post.summary: Create creates a new backup object

get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of objects

parameters.name: enumerate_options.name_filter
parameters.description:
Filter to use for name of objects. Any object that contains the filter
will be returned.

parameters.name: enumerate_options.cluster_name_filter
parameters.description:
Filter to use for cluster name of objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned.

get.summary: Inspect returns detail information about a specified object

delete.summary: Delete triggers delete of a backup

post.summary: Verify if a backup location is valid

get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of backup locations
Inspect returns detailed information about a specified backup location

parameters.name: delete_backups
parameters.description:
delete_backups indicates whether the cloud backup files need to
be deleted or retained.

get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of backup schedule
Inspect returns detail information about a specified backup schedule

parameters.name: delete_backups
parameters.description:
delete_backups indicates whether the cloud backup files need to
be deleted or retained.

get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of cloud credentials
Inspect returns detailed information about the specified cloud credential
Enumerate returns a list of clusters
Inspect returns detail information about a specified cluster

parameters.name: delete_backups
parameters.description:
delete_backups indicates whether the backup related to cluster need to
be deleted or retained.

parameters.name: delete_restores
parameters.description:
delete_restores indicates whether the restore related to cluster  need to
be deleted or retained.

get.summary: Status checks the health of the server
Enumerate returns a list of license for given cluster
Enumerate returns a list of organization object

post.summary: Create creates new organization object in datastore

get.summary: Inspect returns detailed information about specified organization object

post.summary:
Create creates new restore object in datastore
It will also trigger a restore operation on the target cluster

get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of restore objects

parameters.name: enumerate_options.name_filter
parameters.description:
Filter to use for name of objects. Any object that contains the filter
will be returned.

parameters.name: enumerate_options.cluster_name_filter
parameters.description:
Filter to use for cluster name of objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned.

get.summary: Inspect returns detailed information about specified restore object
Enumerate returns a list of rules
Inspect returns detailed information about the specified rule
Enumerate returns a list of schedule policy
Inspect returns detail information about a specified schedule policy
Get gets the version of the server

Namespaces to backup. Only an admin can provide multiple namespaces
Namespaces to backup. Only an admin can provide multiple namespaces

cloud_credential.title: Reference to cloud credential object used for backup

belong to given cluster needs to be deleted or not.

time_range.title: Time range for which to return objects

cluster_name_filter.title:
Filter to use for cluster name of objects. Any object that contains the

labels.title: label selectors for the object for filtering

namespace_mapping.title: mapping of the namespaces from the backup to which restore should be done

replace_policy.title: replace policy to use if the resource already exists

include_optional_resource_types.title: optional resource types to be restored (eg Jobs)

backup.title: Name of backup to restore from

backup_location.title: Name of backup location to restore from

RestoreInfoStatusInfo.description: Message for maintaing status of the object.

RestoreObject.description: Message for Restore object which will be stored in Datastore.

RulesInfo.title: Message for passing pre and post exec rules for backup

backup_schedule.description: list of backup schedule object that uses this schedule policy.

time.description:
Time, when the policy should be triggered. Expected format is
time.Kitchen eg 12:04PM or 12:04pm.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for daily policy, default value is 10.

incremental_count.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.

minutes.description: Interval in minutes at which an action should be triggered.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for interval policy, default value is 10.

incremental_count.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.

date.description:
Date of the month when the policy should be triggered. If a given
date
doesn't exist in a month it'll rollover to the next date of the
month.
For example if 31 is specified, it'll trigger on either 1st or 2nd
March
depending on if it is a leap year.

time.description:
Time, when the policy should be triggered. Expected format is
time.Kitchen eg 12:04PM or 12:04pm.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for monthly policy, default value is 10.

incremental_count.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.

day.title:
Day of the week when the policy should be triggered.
For example, sunday or sun

time.description:
Time, when the policy should be triggered. Expected format is
time.Kitchen eg 12:04PM or 12:04pm.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for weekly policy, default value is 10.

incremental_count.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.
